methodRU: Pour peach puree into the mixing glass with ice, add the Prosecco wine. Stir gently and pour in a chilled flute glass.
methodEN: Pour peach puree into the mixing glass with ice, add the Prosecco wine. Stir gently and pour in a chilled flute glass.

methodRU: Pour the ingredients into the old fashioned glass filled with ice cubes. Stir gently.
methodEN: Pour the ingredients into the old fashioned glass filled with ice cubes. Stir gently.
noteRU: WHITE RUSSIAN – Float fresh cream on the top and stir in slowly.
noteEN: WHITE RUSSIAN – Float fresh cream on the top and stir in slowly.

methodRU: Stir gently all the ingredients in a mixing glass with ice, pour into rocks glass.
methodEN: Stir gently all the ingredients in a mixing glass with ice, pour into rocks glass.
noteRU: If requested served with ice, pour into highball glass.
noteEN: If requested served with ice, pour into highball glass.

methodRU: Place lime and sugar into a double old fashioned glass and muddle gently. Fill the glass with cracked ice and add Cachaça. Stir gently to involve ingredients.
methodEN: Place lime and sugar into a double old fashioned glass and muddle gently. Fill the glass with cracked ice and add Cachaça. Stir gently to involve ingredients.
noteRU:
CAIPIROSKA - Instead of Cachaça use Vodka;
CAIPIRISSIMA - Instead of Cachaça use Rum.
noteEN:
CAIPIROSKA - Instead of Cachaça use Vodka;
CAIPIRISSIMA - Instead of Cachaça use Rum.

methodRU: Place the sugar cube with 2 dashes of biaers in a large Champagne glass, add the cognac. Pour gently chilled Champagne.
methodEN: Place the sugar cube with 2 dashes of biaers in a large Champagne glass, add the cognac. Pour gently chilled Champagne.
garnishRU: Garnish with orange zest and maraschino cherry.
garnishEN: Garnish with orange zest and maraschino cherry.

methodRU: Add all ingredients into cocktail shaker filled with ice. Shake well and strain into large cocktail glass.
methodEN: Add all ingredients into cocktail shaker filled with ice. Shake well and strain into large cocktail glass.

methodRU: Pour all ingredients into shaker with ice. Shake well and strain in chilled cocktail glass.
methodEN: Pour all ingredients into shaker with ice. Shake well and strain in chilled cocktail glass.

methodRU: Build all ingredients in a highball glass filled with ice.
methodEN: Build all ingredients in a highball glass filled with ice.

methodRU: Pour all the ingredients, except Champagne, into a shaker. Shake well and strain into a Champagne flute. Top up with Champagne. Stir gently
methodEN: Pour all the ingredients, except Champagne, into a shaker. Shake well and strain into a Champagne flute. Top up with Champagne. Stir gently

methodRU: Pour all ingredients directly into old fashioned glass filled with ice cubes. Stir gently.
methodEN: Pour all ingredients directly into old fashioned glass filled with ice cubes. Stir gently.

methodRU: Pour all ingredients into shaker filled with ice. Shake briskly for few seconds. Strain into chilled cocktail glass.
methodEN: Pour all ingredients into shaker filled with ice. Shake briskly for few seconds. Strain into chilled cocktail glass.

methodRU: Pour all ingredients into shaker filled with ice. Shake briskly for few seconds. Strain into chilled cocktail glass.
methodEN: Pour all ingredients into shaker filled with ice. Shake briskly for few seconds. Strain into chilled cocktail glass.

methodRU: Pour all ingredients into a shaker with ice. Shake well and strain into a large cocktail glass.
methodEN: Pour all ingredients into a shaker with ice. Shake well and strain into a large cocktail glass.

methodRU: Pour Cognac and ginger ale directly into highball glass with ice cubes. Stir gently. If preferred, add dashes of Angostura Bitter.
methodEN: Pour Cognac and ginger ale directly into highball glass with ice cubes. Stir gently. If preferred, add dashes of Angostura Bitter.
garnishRU: Garnish with rind of one lemon spiral.
garnishEN: Garnish with rind of one lemon spiral.

methodRU: Warm black coffee is poured into a pre-heated Irish coffee glass. Whiskey and at least one teaspoon of sugar is added and sUrred until dissolved. Fresh thick chilled cream is carefully poured over the back of a spoon held just above the surface of the coffee. The layer of cream will float on the coffee without mixing. Plain sugar can be replaced with sugar syrup
methodEN: Warm black coffee is poured into a pre-heated Irish coffee glass. Whiskey and at least one teaspoon of sugar is added and sUrred until dissolved. Fresh thick chilled cream is carefully poured over the back of a spoon held just above the surface of the coffee. The layer of cream will float on the coffee without mixing. Plain sugar can be replaced with sugar syrup

methodRU: Pour Crème de Cassis into glass, top up with white wine.
methodEN: Pour Crème de Cassis into glass, top up with white wine.
noteRU: KIR ROYAL - Use Champagne instead of white wine
noteEN: KIR ROYAL - Use Champagne instead of white wine

methodRU: Add all ingredients into highball glass filled with ice. Stir gently.
methodEN: Add all ingredients into highball glass filled with ice. Stir gently.

methodRU:
Add all ingredients into a shaker with ice. Shake and pour into a double rocks glass or an highball glass.
* The Martinique molasses rum used by Trader Vic was not an Agricole rum but a type of "rummy" from molasses.
methodEN:
Add all ingredients into a shaker with ice. Shake and pour into a double rocks glass or an highball glass.
* The Martinique molasses rum used by Trader Vic was not an Agricole rum but a type of "rummy" from molasses.

garnishEN: Garnish with pineapple spear, mint leaves and lime peel.

methodRU: Add all ingredients into a shaker with ice. Shake and strain into a chilled cocktail glass
methodEN: Add all ingredients into a shaker with ice. Shake and strain into a chilled cocktail glass

methodRU: Pour orange juice into flute glass and gently pour the sparkling wine. Stir gently.
methodEN: Pour orange juice into flute glass and gently pour the sparkling wine. Stir gently.

methodRU: In Julep Stainless Steel Cup gently muddle the mint with sugar and water. Fill the glass with cracked ice, add the Bourbon and sUr well until the cup frosts.
methodEN: In Julep Stainless Steel Cup gently muddle the mint with sugar and water. Fill the glass with cracked ice, add the Bourbon and sUr well until the cup frosts.

methodRU: Mix mint springs with sugar and lime juice. Add splash of soda water and fill the glass with ice. Pour the rum and top with soda water. Light stir to involve all ingredients.
methodEN: Mix mint springs with sugar and lime juice. Add splash of soda water and fill the glass with ice. Pour the rum and top with soda water. Light stir to involve all ingredients.

garnishEN: Garnish with sprigs of mint and slice of lime

methodRU: In an Mule Cup or rocks glass, combine the vodka and ginger beer. Add lime juice and gently stir to involve all ingredients.
methodEN: In an Mule Cup or rocks glass, combine the vodka and ginger beer. Add lime juice and gently stir to involve all ingredients.

methodRU: Blend all the ingredients with ice in a electric blender, pour into a large glass and serve with straws.
methodEN: Blend all the ingredients with ice in a electric blender, pour into a large glass and serve with straws.
noteRU: Historically a few drops of fresh lime juice was added to taste. 4 slices of fresh pineapple can be used instead of juice
noteEN: Historically a few drops of fresh lime juice was added to taste. 4 slices of fresh pineapple can be used instead of juice

garnishEN: Garnish with a slice of pineapple with a cocktail cherry

garnishEN: Garnish with pineapple and maraschino cherry

methodRU: Add all ingredients into an electric blender with 170 grams of cracked ice. With pulse boaom blend for a few seconds. Serve in a tall tumbler glass.
methodEN: Add all ingredients into an electric blender with 170 grams of cracked ice. With pulse boaom blend for a few seconds. Serve in a tall tumbler glass.

garnishEN: Rub a slice of orange (or lemon) around the rim of the glass and dip it in pulverized white sugar, so that the sugar will adhere to the edge of the glass. Carefully curling place the orange/lemon peel around the inside of the glass.

methodRU: Place sugar cube in old fashioned glass and saturate with biaer, add few dashes of plain water. Muddle until dissolved. Fill the glass with ice cubes and add whiskey. Stir gently.
methodEN: Place sugar cube in old fashioned glass and saturate with biaer, add few dashes of plain water. Muddle until dissolved. Fill the glass with ice cubes and add whiskey. Stir gently.

methodRU: Pour all ingredients into cocktail shaker, shake well with ice, strain into chilled cocktail glass.
methodEN: Pour all ingredients into cocktail shaker, shake well with ice, strain into chilled cocktail glass.

methodRU: Pour all ingredients directly in a small tumbler or a typical terracoaa glass.
methodEN: Pour all ingredients directly in a small tumbler or a typical terracoaa glass.
noteRU: Add dilution up to taste, it can be given by water, ice or fresh juices.
noteEN: Add dilution up to taste, it can be given by water, ice or fresh juices.

methodRU: Pour all ingredients into cocktail shaker, shake well with ice, strain into chilled cocktail glass.
methodEN: Pour all ingredients into cocktail shaker, shake well with ice, strain into chilled cocktail glass.

methodRU: Pour all ingredients except soda water in a cocktail shaker with ice, Shake for two minutes, double strain in a glass, pour the drink back in the shaker and hard shake without ice for one minute. Strain into a highball glass, top up with soda.
methodEN: Pour all ingredients except soda water in a cocktail shaker with ice, Shake for two minutes, double strain in a glass, pour the drink back in the shaker and hard shake without ice for one minute. Strain into a highball glass, top up with soda.
noteRU: The drink was invented by Henry Ramos in 1888, at his bar Meyer’s Table d’Hôtel Internationale in New Orleans. The Ramos Fizz was originally shaken for 12 minutes by a crew of 30 bartenders who passed the shaker from one to another.
noteEN: The drink was invented by Henry Ramos in 1888, at his bar Meyer’s Table d’Hôtel Internationale in New Orleans. The Ramos Fizz was originally shaken for 12 minutes by a crew of 30 bartenders who passed the shaker from one to another.

methodRU: Pour all ingredients directly into an old fashioned glass filled with ice. SUr gently.
methodEN: Pour all ingredients directly into an old fashioned glass filled with ice. SUr gently.

methodRU: Rinse a chilled old-fashioned glass with the absinthe, add crushed ice and set it aside. Stir the remaining ingredients over ice in a mixing glass . Discard the ice and any excess absinthe from the prepared glass, strain the mixed drink into the glass
methodEN: Rinse a chilled old-fashioned glass with the absinthe, add crushed ice and set it aside. Stir the remaining ingredients over ice in a mixing glass . Discard the ice and any excess absinthe from the prepared glass, strain the mixed drink into the glass
noteRU: The original recipe changed after the American Civil War, Rye Whiskey substituted Cognac as it became hard to obtain
noteEN: The original recipe changed after the American Civil War, Rye Whiskey substituted Cognac as it became hard to obtain

methodRU: Pour all ingredients into cocktail shaker, shake well with ice, strain into chilled cocktail glass.

methodRU: Pour all ingredients into cocktail shaker filled with ice. Shake well. Strain into cobbler glass. If served "On the rocks", strain ingredients into old fashioned glass filled with ice.
